Hello all! Today we are announcing the launch of the Creatives DAO. The Creatives DAOâ€™s purpose is to help support the creative Guilds/DAOs within the NEAR ecosystem. Under the new vertical organization of governance and funding dispersal (announced last week), the Creatives DAO will become the overarching body for all creative contributors in the NEAR ecosystem.

Read more in our Creatives DAO Guide and by using the "creatives-dao" tag in the Forum:

messages.text: Hello fam

The goal is for us to have at least 10 (and you can see we are ambitiously shooting for 14+) creative guilds activated within the ecosystem that the community can trust have a certain level of support offerent. 

This goes alongside with Guid onbaording on the "Community OS", which just means, getting onboard with the tools that make a NEAR community unique (SputnikDAOs, community social tokens, NEAR token support for bounties/community building/guild projects). As guilds onboard onto the Community OS, they will also be able to more efficiently support the entire ecosystem because they will be able to use these tools to efficiently support their communities.

messages.text: Just wanted to check in this morning and let you all know what I am up to! Starting yet another DAO called hype DAO which is an artist owned creator collector group. We are going to coordinate some auctions in order to build up our holdings and give artists the equity they deserve
It has a lot of overlap with hype squad DAO which just deployed and is already collecting works via a multi-sig on Ethereum
squad and hype DAO are both running on Sputnik DAO
Well, hypedao isn't deployed yet, still finding that third council member
So I will be on boarding a lot of artists to near this week!

messages.text: ğŸ¥³
Hi guys, Dede and myself are minting our first release in the C1 store.  We have a question about the number of copies... Is it 10 per upload? Or can we offer more then that?
You can mint as many as you want, just 10 per transaction ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½
You're just minting a token with certain data, there's no way to limit that on the blockchain.
Nice
On the UI, it may not show an NFT you have none in your wallet. I'd suggest keeping 1 NFT in your wallet so that you can just click the "+" sign (under the NFT) in order to mint more.
Perfect!  Thanks.

Yw ğŸ˜Š, NEAR blocks have a gas limit, so there's a limit to how many transactions/data can fit into each block.

The limit of 10 comes from Mintbase because if you put more (I don't remember the exact number) the transaction may revert because the block the txn is trying to fit into would be too full to include the txn (effectively the txn would never go through and be stuck)

text: A simple idea for a bounty/application would be an auto minter that minted up to a certain amount of NFTs, 10 at a time to the max amount. Or to have a lazy Minter on NEAR that mints up to 10 when a buyer comes along to purchase. (second option is more reasonable for generative art sets imo so should be included in the generative art project in the works
Something new for us to start testing soon ğŸ˜œ

messages.text: That's sort of like how a 1155 works... You can have one collection the single edition and another collection be fungible non divisible
I know there isn't a 1155 equivalent on near yet
True, but no multi-token standard for nonfundables yet on near.

I see the benefit being the ability to ensure some sort of attentiveness within a community in order to take part in governance. Holding a certain quantity of FT would be enough for general access, but the nft would allow for specific voting rights.
So basically hold x amount of hype token to access perks and base features, then hold specific hype DAO NFT's to have access to certain roles (minting/curating/adding or removing minters)

Hey guys, hope the presentations and updates went well today. 

I have a question regarding the forever royalties in Mintbase.  It is set at the standard of 10%. When minting for other artists, I chose 3% for C1, and 7% for the artist.  Although on the store it shows that my profile is on the forever royalty... Is that just there because I minted?  Is there anyway to see values associated with the royalties?  I'm hoping that I didn't need to convert that 10% to 100 and actually give the artist 70 and C1 30.

text: Hi Justin! I have faced the same query few days back. Please have a look at this video. I hope It will help

messages.text: Thanks Naveen!  I'll have to try again to see what went wrong.  At first when I put the forevers split at 70 / 30 it didn't work. So I just assumed it was only within the 10%.  The rest must have defaulted to me as the minter.
If you leave it blank, it'll use your own address that you used to mint for the  rest of the value.
Yeah and I think I undervalued and then it automatically put me in for the remaining percents.  Issue has been fixed though.   Thanks!
If you only put 3% and 7% that's incorrect. You should put 30% and 70% for the royalties.

Putting this announcement here for the creative devs ğŸ˜‰

â€œHey y'all! Quick announcement from the DevRel Team! Please share this with anyone you think may want to check it out. ğŸ™‚

This week we are kicking off a new initiative to assist our developer community with their projects. Twice a week we will be hosting "Office Hours" where several engineers will hang out and answer any questions you may have about building on NEAR. Sometimes async communication isn't always the best so we're hoping we can provide a platform for those wanting to talk things out and have an instant discussion with a few engineers on the team and establish some face-to-face relationships with our rad community.

We'll start out with these hours and may adjust depending on response, but for now it will be:

12PM - 2PM PST on Tuesdays
9AM - 11AM PST on Fridays

It will be hosted in the
on our Discord server. So bring your questions, ideas, and maybe a cup of joe â˜• and let's chat!â€

messages.text: Where the market stays with the NFT. Similar to Zora protocol, if the market stays with the NFF, the token can be sold on any platform, or even any chain eventually, as long as the assets follow the NFT in the auction/sale.

Also interesting to start thinking about the yield of an NFT's market. For example if there are 10k NEAR in bids on an NFT, that NEAR could be bid in stNEAR and could be gaining yield every 12 hours ğŸ‘€

Arguably you could have the yield being split among the royalty/fee accounts as well every epoch and even if the NFT didn't sell for weeks/months/years, it could still earn revenue for those that worked to create it.

This could also be done on paras or Mintbase for example, but works better imo when the market persists across platforms.

Dear friends! The bot has been updated.

You can now receive message when your wallet addresses are found  in the arguments of a transaction.

You can also add numbers with "d<number>" command (d103451266) for monitoring, and remove them with "off d<number>" (off d103451266) command. This would be useful to keep track of telegram IDs for example. Numbers must be between 4 and 30 characters long.

messages.text: I've only looked at this for about 30 seconds, but we have a voice chat in about 12 minutes where we can dig in a bit deeper. The creatives DAO only submits payout proposals (for the most part) to other creative DAOs. There are a few reasons for this, but the main one is so that we are focusing on funding communities > individuals.

If you'd like to form a community around this project/proposal then that is definitely something that can be discussed ğŸ¥°. The main difference from a one-time proposal and a community would be the amount of people involved in the leadership role, and the metrics and timelines established in my opinion.
That is definitely more what Iâ€™m looking at doing, and I should be able to be on the call for at least a bit!

messages.text: Hello, GM ! Thank you for the reply, I did some easy changes, and now im doing the big part that is write a post of every project at the forum, explaining it more detailed, is that right?

Each proposal should have its own topic created in the forum with more details, metrics for success, goals, etc.

Each of those topics should be looked over and in some way, [APPROVED] by your own community before being added to the proposal to the creatives DAO. 

The idea is that your community has already come together and decided on projects it wants to complete to support itself and then the creatives DAO just looks over the plan to make sure it seems logical and reasonable. Also, we try and make sure there's a responsible spending of funds.

If you look into the subcategory of another Guild/DAO, it should be very clear how things are being done currently. Not all guilds have subcategories, so they manage their topics in the main "Creatives" category.
Okay. ^^ I will be back when we finish this them. Thank you again

messages.text: ğŸ‘ so long as all the minters on the store have been informed in advance and consent, yay for sustainability measures!
50% as in 50 % of royalty fee or over item price/sale?
At least ğŸ˜…. 50% is reasonable. I do the same for the open marmaj store. And 10% royalties as well.
Also, these settings are only in the UI ğŸ˜… can be bypassed though CLI btw.

So imo, it's completely reasonable to set first sale splits however seems most sustainable. The 10% royalty split would be cool to simply set to the store contract since the owner should be able to remove added storage as well. This would allow a DAO as owner to simply withdraw the additional storage back to the DAO address when it wasn't needed.

This also helps for when/if the DAO address changes. Many guilds are currently using v1 SputnikDAO's which will NOT have the same address as v2 or astro, so setting royalties to these v1 DAOs is probably not very efficient.

Mintbase contracts are upgradable at the moment so royalties to that address is more reasonable to last long term ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½ (some v1 DAO accounts are gunna be super valuable in the future randomly tho ğŸ˜…)

messages.text:
Once we move to astro DAO, it should be more efficient to gauge Community interest in proposed implementations.

Idea being, that we could have a DAO based on NFT voting weight where each "member" is able to stake their membership NFT into the DAO to signal their approval (or disapproval) of a decision.
Can't wait for this! We've been talking about NFT membership for NxM, with various ranking based on contribution - member, contributor, team.. seeing what could work.

Yessss. Exactly. Different "rankings" could have different staking weight on the DAO when staked for voting. I like the idea of metamon type "combine and evolve" NFTs.

Take a membership of weight 1 + membership of weight 2 and they burn to mint an NFT with weight 3 ğŸ™ŒğŸ½
Simple way for Contributors to collect NFTs for a certain DAO and provides a reason for resale as well (which boosts the DAO treasury w royalties)
woow another level of membership :D this transition to astro DAO sounds very exciting :)

Ok thanks. I know someone was working on multiple policy types for one DAO, which seems useful. true ğŸ‘€. sounds fun and too complicated for me to speak intelligibly on it, will think more on it ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½. Main issue being how to actually connect the DAOs to make them "sub-DAOs" instead of just being multiple independant DAOs

Okay, now that my coffee has kicked in, makes sense ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½. Would be interesting to have the sub DAO propose both a "FOR" and "AGAINST" proposal on the same vote, and whichever gains enough weight to pass first would be the deciding vote. (makes it simpler to incentivize voting in general regardless of choice)

2 proposals could make sense since a thumb up or down are discrete actions. Wonder if there's a clean way to represent that in the UI or use a 3rd contract to check how the sub vote went and then take action on the parent dao proposal.

V2 and astro are the same contracts, just different front ends.
ah, ok :)

super curious to see how that will affect the decision making, at the DAO level

messages.text: cool, mixed system, different 'reputation' metrics, I like it.
Yeahhhh. Imo it's a bit simpler to distribute NFTs to users and then the longer they stake the more weight they would have. If they withdraw, then staking weight goes back to 1

Just changing the name of the chat to reflect that this group is not just for Creative Guild leaders but for anyone in the creatives ecosystem at near who wants to learn more about getting involved ğŸ’
sounds more difficult if there are a bigger number of nfts staked by one person tho
A single account would only be allowed to stake one nft at a time ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½
ah yeah that makes it easy then lol
Additional staking weight could be added to the staked nft as they complete proposals ğŸ™ŒğŸ½
ğŸ‘
So basically burn and remit upon successful proposal completion (with additional time based weight added as well)
burn and remit u mean remint for succesfull proposals? why do that if you can edit it ğŸ¤”
What exactly are you saying can be edited?

The DAO would burn the nft with staking weight 1, and remint an NFT with staking weight > 1 for the same user, proportionate to the length of time they have been staking and the additional reward for completing the proposal.

edit the staking weight that shows in the nft if both the nft and the dao contract are made by the same project that sounds like an easier thing then reminting every time a proposal gets completed but that might just be me

It wouldn't be reminted for everyone, just the person that completed the proposal. And I suppose to flow you are proposing works as well, but "editing the metadata" and "burn + remint" are pretty similar functionality imo.

Either way you have to basically completely change the NFTs value. (nft with staking weight = 1 no longer exists and nft with staking weight > 1 does)
ğŸ’«
if you have vote weight on chain it would be simpler then metadata that will likely be stored offchain or on ipfs
Depends where it's stored yeah. I definitely wouldn't be storing my communities metadata in a centralized sever or IPFS tho personally. I like persistent storage
fact remains that storing the nft vote weight onchain is probably easier to use and update then storing off the near chain

Vote weight can be stored on chain for sure ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½. I'm not sure it's much more complicated or simple either way personally. Either way it's a function call and an outcome. Calling old state from near chain requires access to archived data iirc which personally seems more complicated than accessing arweave for example.
Haven't tried it personally tho ğŸ¤·ğŸ¾â€â™€ï¸
updating on arweave from a smart contract doesnt sound to easy to me either tho
You wouldn't update on arweave in the flow I'm stating, just mint a new nft.
Arweave is persistent storage anyway, so no updating.
The initial data for the nft will always exist on arweave ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½
It'll just not be an nft on the near Blockchain anymore. This supports the ability to use old metadata for a reputation system across communities as well imo.

messages.text: Most onboarding flows for creatives in the near ecosystem are quite similar. People need to get a near account and understand how to use the wallet. They also need to understand how to use a few of the main nft platforms. From there they need to understand the funding flows and where funding comes from.
Generally, funding always comes from an on chain DAO, after submitting an off chain proposal to the near forums. There can be visuals that are different, but the flow is generally consistent
You're very welcome ğŸ¥°

The system is similar, but when we communicate, our values, mission, enviroment are builded at the visual identity. We can have a similar pdf for nxm or theclan. But the target of the crowd have differences. Like nxm is a dao focused at music. So they need to have music at their communication pieces. The Clan is more graphics, tavern, family stuff. So it needs to communicate it. And every flow its almost the same, but its not.
Of course each Guild will have its own resources I was more speaking to not having to create brand new flows if they are already being worked on or already exist.
ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½

Of course not. But it kinds of happens, as everyone will need to do its own material if is needed. To share the systens its a nice thing, as each guild have its own research and mechanism. We need our crowd to onboard at near, be a minter at theclan store, then create a lynkfire, reg at forum, follow the medias, mint a nft.

The Clan will present the Id Visual process when its finished for example. We are creating all the visual using AI gans and smartphone apps. So we will share the how to. We developed social mediad strategies to maximize the range and quickly growth, so we will share these strategies also when we finish the building. This kind of trade is really powerful.
Yes, the funding part its the same. And I liked the "on chain and off chain" terms.

messages.text: ğŸ¤

Yea :). So a little background on me. I have a community I created around celebrating Black creators and digital content. My goal is to bridge the gap for these often underserved creators to learn new skills around emerging media and technology. I am planning programming for next year. Part of that is focusing on the NFT space. I want to create an accelerator/fellowship for creators to develop their own nft projects. Im exoring NEAR as that technology as the dev and. Community seems approachable. Also looking into funding resources to help creators fund these projects.
*exploring
Hey Victoria! Welcome to the group! :) I am also new here but your idea can have bridges to the idea that I just presented here. Let me reping the presentatiom that I created.
If you see any matches between the two projects, let me know. I am open to discuss it over dms too. :)
Hey ppl, i think we can develop together also
Do you already have a community of creators? Or are you looking to grow one as you learn more about programming in the blockchain space?
I'll review and get back to you
Thanks
Thanks everyone for the support and warm welcome
So I do have creators I've worked with in the past who I think maybe interested in doing a fellowship. Regarding creators to develop the program no...

A great way to start could be to explore the existing creative guilds/DAOs and potentially get involved in ongoing projects or propose a project of your own. I find that this is a good way to learn about the ecosystem ğŸ˜
Thank you. Im definitely learning piece by piece.

text: hey all! Just to follow up after presenting my idea, I've gathered all suggestions (especially from

ğŸ˜Š) and I am building a roadmap for different development stages. But first, considering the structure of a DAO, what is your advice for the size of it? As far as I understand, there is a council that manages the DAO activity. How many people is the ideal?

messages.text: I am asking because I am starting to outreach the communities involved in my idea

I suppose it depends on what type of governance system you plan to use. Most DAOs currently use a council based role system where more than 50% yes votes are needed to pass. In this case, usually between three and five members is appropriate. 

You can also set up numerous different rules though that have different governance mechanisms ğŸ˜…. Also, you do not have to have it so that it takes 50% yes votes to pass, for example if only 20% yes votes are needed to pass then having 10 council members or more might be appropriate because less active council members will be needed to pass proposals.

messages.text: How the correct way to make a proposal for the marketing vertical forum?

text: just found out. Go to marketing - marketingdao, new proposal it will open a template

So, youâ€™re looking to fund your freshest marketing plan for your project, Guild, or initiative based in the NEAR Ecosystem.
Look no further, weâ€™ve got all the details youâ€™re looking for right here!:point_down:

1. Getting Started
Post a â€˜new topicâ€™ in the Marketing Category under the Marketing DAO Subcategory
Add the marketing-dao , proposals and daos tags
Make sure your post title begins with [Proposal]

> e.g [PROPOSAL] July 2021 Social Media Moderation budget for X Guild
> Give a brief overview of the project youâ€™re proposing funding for in the title - short and sweet!

2. Include which type of marketing this falls under the umbrella of, e.g - Social Media, Advertising, Blogs, Events, etc
3. Sculpting a Proposal

What to include:
* Guild name (if applicable)
* Funding scheme: Monthly / Quarterly / Milestone-based / One-time etc.
* Initiative summary, be sure to include:
* Expected impact and value you foresee for the NEAR ecosystem/community
* Metrics for measuring success
* Estimated timeline and achievement milestones
* Links to similar, previously funded forum proposals (if applicable)
* Funding Details
* Total requested amount in USD and NEAR (price based at the time of posting)
* NEAR Wallet ID / DAO
* Wallet ownerâ€™s name

text:
Hello everyone. 

We are updating our CC NEAR Project, and we want to invite all the DAOs to be part of. 

People can participate as users too.

Its a simple folder under a

. CC is for Creative Commons, and its a way to share any file, free for use. 

One good use is to share the visual id material, so all of the logos and elements will be at one place, so designers, artists can easily find them, when they need, to create promotional pieces, for example.

Visual artists can share material for collages, musicians can collaborate with soundclipsntomthe community, and so on. 

We are at a google drive plataform now, but the idea is to migrate to a decentralized structure, at a near future. 

Our folders link
Thank you, and if you want to participate, send us a DM with a near wallet for the folder name, or the daos name, and a email address tombe added as editor to your folder.

messages.text: Mostly thinking about ways to introduce simple onboarding for web2 crowd in Antigua hopefully.

generally cc wouldn't be required for us, attendees to the gallery would receive marmaj tokens for free upon entering and would be able to spend their tokens on any NFTs in the gallery. More of an educational experience to teach about FT swaps, NFT purchasing and split royalties/fees. Tbh I think about this more like a school field-trip than anything esle.

For example if the NFTs were of historical black figures in the Caribbean and the slit sales/royalties went to not only the artist rendition's of the historical figures, but also a non profit supporting continued education surrounding these topics.

Also, the accounts that the students use for the "field-trip" could be accounts with access keys that only allow for select function interactions on Mintbase and only swaps on certain ref pools. At the end of the day, unused funds would/could be swept back to the Marma J Foundation, and the collected NFTs could simply be on display in a curated gallery for an account "owned" by the school or something ğŸ¤·ğŸ½â€â™€ï¸ (we could hold the keys, but raised funds could be held and sold off/donated each quarter and go back to the school/ministry of education)
